intro: Calamus spinifolius, commonly known as the spiny-leafed arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, serrated leaves. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Calamus spinifolius make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ethnobotanical study.
